intro: Hypecoum aegyptiacum, commonly known as Egyptian cocklebur, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hypecoum aegyptiacum is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine.
